trial_identification.studytitle: The effect of atorvastatin on lung function and morbidity as add-on therapy in asthmatic patients. A double-blind randomized cross-over trial.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effect of atorvastatin on lung function and morbidity as add-on therapy in normolipid asthmatic patients. A double-blind placebo controlled randomized cross-over trial.

interventions.interventions: atorvastatin 10 mg per day oral for one month or placebo oral for one month, each therapy separated with 2 weeks wash out period (cross-over)

primaryOutcome.outcome: Changes in Forced Expiratory Volume in one second (FEV1)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline and after 4 weeks of each intervention (placebo or atorvastatin therapy)
At baseline and after 4 weeks of each intervention (placebo or atorvastatin therapy)
At baseline and after 4 weeks of each intervention (placebo or atorvastatin therapy)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Changes in score of Jones Index of Morbidity
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline and after 4 weeks of each intervention (placebo or atorvastatin therapy).

eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Dyslipidemia, adverse effect due to atorvastatin, other comorbid condition (heart failure, diabetes, MI, hypertension), receiving medication(s) interact with atorvastatin.

trial_design.concealment: allocation concealed by sealed opaque envelopes
trial_design.sequence: Simple randomisation by using a randomisation table from a statistic book
trial_design.designfeatures: the people receiving the treatment/s (subjects), the clinician administering the treatment/s, the researcher assessing the outcomes are blinded in the study

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: Shaheed Beheshti University of Medical Sciences, Iran

fundingsource.fundingname: National Research Institute of Tuberculosis and Lung Disease

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The main goal of the study was to assess the effects of atorvastatin on asthma as an inflammatory disease.
